title: How to Fix Volume Issues on a Firestick Remote

steps.title: If the sound is off, the volume buttons won't work.
steps.content: If the sound is off, the volume buttons won't work. Chances are high that a friend, pet, or someone else accidentally muted the TV, causing the buttons on your remote to not work. Try pressing the Mute button on your Firestick remote (it looks like a speaker with an "X" next to it). If your TV has a separate remote that you use in addition to the Firestick remote, check the mute button on that as well.

steps.title: Dead batteries are a common culprit.
steps.content: Dead batteries are a common culprit. This is most likely the reason why your volume buttons worked before and don't now.

steps.title: This issue is especially common during the holidays.
steps.content: This issue is especially common during the holidays. A decoration, like a snow globe or a ceramic object, can block the sensors on the TV so the remote doesn't consistently work.

steps.title: Outdated software can cause glitches.
steps.content: Outdated software can cause glitches. Go to Settings > Controllers and Bluetooth Devices > Amazon Fire TV Remotes , select your remote, and install an update if one is available. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Rebooting can solve a lot of issues.
steps.content: Rebooting can solve a lot of issues. Unplug the TV from power for a few seconds, then plug it back in.

steps.title: If the Firestick is connected to the wrong port, some buttons won't work.
steps.content: If the Firestick is connected to the wrong port, some buttons won't work. The HDMI-CEC port is generally clearly marked on the back of your TV, but you can also look online or through the user's manual to find it. Try the remote again after changing to the correct port. You may need to go to Settings through your TV to enable audio control via HDMI-CEC.

steps.title: Many soundbars and sound systems come with their own remote to control the volume.
steps.content: Many soundbars and sound systems come with their own remote to control the volume. Use the same remote as the branded sound system to be able to turn the sound up or down.

steps.title: Firestick may not be connected to your speakers.
steps.content: Firestick may not be connected to your speakers. Go to Settings > Equipment Control > Manage Equipment to make sure audio control is enabled with your remote. Select Add equipment if you don't see your speakers.

steps.title: Pairing too many devices can prevent your remote from working properly.
steps.content: Pairing too many devices can prevent your remote from working properly. Go to Settings > Controllers & Bluetooth Devices > Other Bluetooth Devices , then unpair anything you're not using.

steps.title: This might fix connection issues.
steps.content: This might fix connection issues. First, use your phone as a Fire TV Stick remote (by downloading the mobile app and following the on-screen instructions), then unpair your physical remote this way: Go to Settings > Controllers & Bluetooth Devices > Remotes > OK . Choose your remote so it'll unpair. Since you don't have a remote paired to the TV, you'll need to switch to using your phone to control the Fire TV Stick. In Settings > Controllers & Bluetooth Devices > Remotes > Add New Remote (using the mobile app on your phone which is connected to your TV). Choose your remote and pair it. See if the volume controls work.

steps.title: Try this method to clear glitches in your connection.
steps.content: Try this method to clear glitches in your connection. Go to Settings > Account & Profile Settings > Amazon Account > Deregister then register it again the same way. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Use this workaround if the buttons still won't work.
steps.content: Use this workaround if the buttons still won't work. If you can't get your remote to control the volume, you can ask Alexa instead. Simply say, "Alexa, volume up" or "Alexa, volume down" to adjust the sound levels.

steps.title: The mobile app doubles as a remote.
steps.content: The mobile app doubles as a remote. If using Alexa isn't an option, you can use the Fire TV Stick mobile app to control the volume.
